trans-unit.source: Configure a DNS Label for the public IP address
trans-unit.target: Configure a DNS Label for the public IP address

trans-unit.source: To connect to the SQL Server Database Engine from the Internet, first configure a DNS Label for your public IP address.
trans-unit.target: To connect to the SQL Server Database Engine from the Internet, first configure a DNS Label for your public IP address.

trans-unit.source: Note that this step is not necessary if you plan to only connect to the SQL Server instance within the same Virtual Network or only locally.
trans-unit.target: Note that this step is not necessary if you plan to only connect to the SQL Server instance within the same Virtual Network or only locally.

trans-unit.source: To create a DNS Label, first select **Virtual machines** in the portal.
trans-unit.target: To create a DNS Label, first select **Virtual machines** in the portal.

trans-unit.source: Select your SQL Server VM to bring up its properties.
trans-unit.target: Select your SQL Server VM to bring up its properties.

trans-unit.source: In the virtual machine blade, select your **Public IP address.**
trans-unit.target: In the virtual machine blade, select your **Public IP address.**

trans-unit.source: In the properties for your Public IP address, expand **Configuration**.
trans-unit.target: In the properties for your Public IP address, expand **Configuration**.

trans-unit.source: This is an A Record that can be used to connect to your SQL Server VM by name instead of by IP Address directly.
trans-unit.target: This is an A Record that can be used to connect to your SQL Server VM by name instead of by IP Address directly.

trans-unit.source: Connect to the Database Engine from another computer
trans-unit.target: Connect to the Database Engine from another computer

trans-unit.source: On a computer connected to the internet, open SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS).
trans-unit.target: On a computer connected to the internet, open SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS).

trans-unit.source: In the **Connect to Server** or **Connect to Database Engine** dialog box, in the**Server name** box, enter the full DNS name of the virtual machine (determined in the previous task).
trans-unit.target: In the **Connect to Server** or **Connect to Database Engine** dialog box, in the**Server name** box, enter the full DNS name of the virtual machine (determined in the previous task).

trans-unit.source: In the **Authentication** box, select **SQL Server Authentication**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Authentication** box, select **SQL Server Authentication**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Login** box, type the name of a valid SQL login.
trans-unit.target: In the **Login** box, type the name of a valid SQL login.

trans-unit.source: In the **Password** box, type the password of the login.
trans-unit.target: In the **Password** box, type the password of the login.
